title: Live updates: Israel and U.S. condemn ICC arrest warrants; other nations vow to enforce
content: The court issued warrants for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and the former defense minister “for crimes against humanity and war crimes.” It also issued a warrant for a Hamas military leader.
summary: The court issued warrants for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and the former defense minister “for crimes against humanity and war crimes.” It also issued a warrant for a Hamas military leader.

title: Netanyahu calls ICC’s decision ‘antisemitic,’ ‘distorted’
Senate Democrats force Israel weapons vote, citing Biden inaction
content: The Senate ultimately voted down the measure, brought by Sen. Bernie Sanders and Democratic allies, to block the sale of some U.S.-made weapons to Israel.
summary: The Senate ultimately voted down the measure, brought by Sen. Bernie Sanders and Democratic allies, to block the sale of some U.S.-made weapons to Israel.

title: Senate Democrats force Israel weapons vote, citing Biden inaction

content: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned the United States and Ukraine’s other partners that the weapon could be deployed against their interests as well.

title: ICC arrest warrants accuse Netanyahu, Gallant of war crimes in Gaza
content: The International Criminal Court said the alleged crimes include starvation as a method of warfare, murder, persecution and other inhuman acts.
summary: The International Criminal Court said the alleged crimes include starvation as a method of warfare, murder, persecution and other inhuman acts.

content: Adani is seen as an arm of Indian domestic and foreign policy — and a proxy for Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Iceland volcano spews glowing lava in seventh eruption in a year
content: The eruption — the 10th on the Reykjanes Peninsula since 2021 — began with little warning. The nearby town of Grindavik and the Blue Lagoon were evacuated.
summary: The eruption — the 10th on the Reykjanes Peninsula since 2021 — began with little warning. The nearby town of Grindavik and the Blue Lagoon were evacuated.

World’s tallest and shortest women meet for afternoon tea in London
content: The world’s tallest woman, Rumeysa Gelgi, met with the shortest woman, Jyoti Amge, bonding over their shared interests while celebrating their differences.
summary: The world’s tallest woman, Rumeysa Gelgi, met with the shortest woman, Jyoti Amge, bonding over their shared interests while celebrating their differences.

Billionaire Gautam Adani indicted in New York in alleged bribery scheme
content: Indian energy mogul Gautam Adani, an ally of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, was indicted in New York on bribery charges involving solar energy supply contracts.
summary: Indian energy mogul Gautam Adani, an ally of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, was indicted in New York on bribery charges involving solar energy supply contracts.

title: Paws up! Police find shoe thief at a kindergarten is actually a weasel.
content: Police in southwest Japan installed cameras after nearly two dozen children’s shoes went missing from Gosho Kodomo-en kindergarten in Fukuoka. The culprit? A weasel.
summary: Police in southwest Japan installed cameras after nearly two dozen children’s shoes went missing from Gosho Kodomo-en kindergarten in Fukuoka. The culprit? A weasel.

title: Fearing war, Georgia chooses a return to Russia’s embrace
content: The pro-Russian ruling party claimed victory in an election rife with violations with the message that angering Moscow risks turning Georgia into another Ukraine.
summary: The pro-Russian ruling party claimed victory in an election rife with violations with the message that angering Moscow risks turning Georgia into another Ukraine.

title: Who is Gautam Adani? Indian billionaire hit with fraud charges in U.S.
content: Adani, an Indian business magnate and one of the richest men in Asia, faces new allegations of fraud to secure solar energy supply contracts.
summary: Adani, an Indian business magnate and one of the richest men in Asia, faces new allegations of fraud to secure solar energy supply contracts.

title: Brazil marks Black Consciousness Day, a new holiday, for first time
content: The holiday marks the anniversary of the death of Zumbi, a key figure in Black resistance to slavery in Brazil.
summary: The holiday marks the anniversary of the death of Zumbi, a key figure in Black resistance to slavery in Brazil.

title: Can Lebanon’s army secure the south? A cease-fire deal could depend on it.
content: The readiness of Lebanon’s army is a matter of growing urgency as the Biden administration makes a new push for an end to the war between Israel and Hezbollah.
summary: The readiness of Lebanon’s army is a matter of growing urgency as the Biden administration makes a new push for an end to the war between Israel and Hezbollah.

title: U.S. Embassy in Kyiv closes over attack fears after Ukraine strikes Russia
content: The announcement came a day after Ukraine used U.S.-supplied missiles to strike inside Russia, raising fears of retaliation against the capital.
summary: The announcement came a day after Ukraine used U.S.-supplied missiles to strike inside Russia, raising fears of retaliation against the capital.

title: What are antipersonnel mines, widely banned weapons Biden is giving Ukraine?
content: President Joe Biden agreed to provide antipersonnel land mines to Ukraine as Russian troops advance. The weapon is banned in over 160 countries.
summary: President Joe Biden agreed to provide antipersonnel land mines to Ukraine as Russian troops advance. The weapon is banned in over 160 countries.

title: What to know about ‘Rust’ premiere, three years after fatal shooting
content: Alec Baldwin’s Western “Rust” premiered in Poland on Wednesday, three years after cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was fatally shot on set.
summary: Alec Baldwin’s Western “Rust” premiered in Poland on Wednesday, three years after cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was fatally shot on set.

title: Media publisher Jimmy Lai defiant as he takes the stand in Hong Kong
content: The sentencing of pro-democracy activists and the trial of media mogul Jimmy Lai show how Hong Kong’s courts are becoming a tool for repression, analysts say.
summary: The sentencing of pro-democracy activists and the trial of media mogul Jimmy Lai show how Hong Kong’s courts are becoming a tool for repression, analysts say.

title: Ugandan opposition politician Kizza Besigye kidnapped and jailed, wife says
content: Besigye was arrested in Kenya and taken across the border to a Ugandan military jail, according to his wife, Winnie Byanyima, head of the U.N. HIV/AIDS program.
summary: Besigye was arrested in Kenya and taken across the border to a Ugandan military jail, according to his wife, Winnie Byanyima, head of the U.N. HIV/AIDS program.

title: How Trump’s tariffs could spark a trade war and ‘Europe’s worst economic nightmare’
content: European countries could be among those hardest hit if Trump follows through on tariffs. The European Union says it wants to negotiate but is prepared to retaliate.
summary: European countries could be among those hardest hit if Trump follows through on tariffs. The European Union says it wants to negotiate but is prepared to retaliate.

title: Son of Norway’s crown princess arrested on suspicion of rape, police say
content: Marius Borg Hoiby has no royal title or duties, but as the stepson of the heir to the throne, his arrest has cast a cloud over Norway’s popular royal family.
summary: Marius Borg Hoiby has no royal title or duties, but as the stepson of the heir to the throne, his arrest has cast a cloud over Norway’s popular royal family.

title: How a brutally repressive African country freely raises money in the U.S.
content: Eritrea’s embassy has helped raise millions of dollars to promote the interests of the brutally repressive country. Its ruling party is under U.S. sanctions.
summary: Eritrea’s embassy has helped raise millions of dollars to promote the interests of the brutally repressive country. Its ruling party is under U.S. sanctions.

title: Biden drifts off the world stage after Brazil’s G-20
content: The trip that was supposed to be the U.S. president’s swan song seemed to underscore his status as a lame duck.
summary: The trip that was supposed to be the U.S. president’s swan song seemed to underscore his status as a lame duck.

title: Biden approves antipersonnel mines for Ukraine, undoing his own policy
content: The controversial White House move to send Kyiv land mines comes as Russia’s advances in eastern Ukraine threaten to overwhelm front-line defenses.
summary: The controversial White House move to send Kyiv land mines comes as Russia’s advances in eastern Ukraine threaten to overwhelm front-line defenses.

title: Ukraine fires U.S.-made ATACMS missiles into Russia for first time
content: Ukraine’s ATACMS strike in Russia’s Bryansk region marks an intensification of the war amid uncertainty over Donald Trump’s return to the White House.
summary: Ukraine’s ATACMS strike in Russia’s Bryansk region marks an intensification of the war amid uncertainty over Donald Trump’s return to the White House.

title: Pentagon misstated how Special Operations troops died off Cyprus last year
content: A Special Operations helicopter deployed in response to fighting in Gaza crashed during target practice, not aerial refueling, as the Pentagon said last year.
summary: A Special Operations helicopter deployed in response to fighting in Gaza crashed during target practice, not aerial refueling, as the Pentagon said last year.

title: Iraq bans alcohol in hotels and clubs, bringing country close to near-total ban
content: Alcohol has long been easily accessible in Baghdad, but a crackdown in recent years has made booze much more difficult to find.
summary: Alcohol has long been easily accessible in Baghdad, but a crackdown in recent years has made booze much more difficult to find.
